translations.text: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?<sup foot_note="182460">1</sup>

Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm<sup foot_note="182461">1</sup> so that We might try him,<sup foot_note="182462">2</sup> and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.<sup foot_note="182463">3</sup>
Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful<sup foot_note="182464">1</sup> (to his Lord).
For the unbelievers, We have kept ready chains and fetters and a Blazing Fire.
The virtuous<sup foot_note="182465">1</sup> shall drink from a cup tempered with camphor water.

This will be a gushing spring<sup foot_note="182466">1</sup> wherefrom Allah's servants<sup foot_note="182467">2</sup> shall drink wine, a spring from which they will take out channels wherever they wish.<sup foot_note="182468">3</sup>
These will be the ones who fulfil their vows<sup foot_note="182469">1</sup> and dread the Day whose woe shall be spread far and wide;
those who, for the love of Him,<sup foot_note="182470">1</sup> feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,<sup foot_note="182471">2</sup>
(saying):<sup foot_note="182472">1</sup> “We feed you only for Allah's sake; we do not seek of you any recompense or thanks,<sup foot_note="182473">2</sup>
we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful.”
So Allah shall guard them against the woe of that Day, and will procure them freshness and joy,<sup foot_note="182474">1</sup>
and will reward them for their steadfastness<sup foot_note="182475">1</sup> with Paradise and robes of silk.
There they will recline on elevated couches and will be subjected neither to the burning heat of the sun nor to bitter cold.
The shades of Paradise will bend over them, and its fruits will be brought within their easy reach;
and there shall be passed around them vessels of silver<sup foot_note="182476">1</sup> and goblets of crystal,<sup foot_note="182477">2</sup>
goblets bright as crystal but made of silver, filled to exact measure.<sup foot_note="182478">1</sup>
Therein they shall be served a cup flavoured with ginger,
drawn from a spring (in Paradise) called Salsabil.<sup foot_note="182479">1</sup>
There boys of everlasting youth shall go about attending them: when you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.<sup foot_note="182480">1</sup>
Whitherto you look around, you will see an abundance of bliss and the glories of a great kingdom.<sup foot_note="182481">1</sup>

They [i.e., the virtuous] shall be attired in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade<sup foot_note="182482">1</sup> and will be adorned with bracelets of silver.<sup foot_note="182483">2</sup> Their Lord will give them a pure wine to drink.<sup foot_note="182484">3</sup>
Behold, this is your recompense and your endeavour has been appreciated.<sup foot_note="182485">1</sup>
(O Prophet), indeed We have revealed the Qur'an to you in portions.<sup foot_note="182486">1</sup>
So persevere with the command of your Lord<sup foot_note="182487">1</sup> and do not pay any heed to the wicked and the unbelieving,<sup foot_note="182488">2</sup>
and remember the name of your Lord, morning and evening;
and prostrate yourself before Him at night, and extol His Glory during the long watches of the night.<sup foot_note="182489">1</sup>
Verily they love (the good of this world) that is hastily obtainable and are oblivious of the burdensome Day ahead of them.<sup foot_note="182490">1</sup>
We created them and strengthened their joints; and whenever We wish, We can change their faces entirely.<sup foot_note="182491">1</sup>
Verily this is an Exhortation; so let him who so will take a way to his Lord.
But your willing shall be of no avail until Allah Himself so wills.<sup foot_note="182492">1</sup> Surely Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
He admits to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. As for the wrong-doers, He has prepared for them a grievous chastisement.<sup foot_note="182493">1</sup>
